Posts.Content: I am not from where you are but my husband had Davinci surgery on feb 20 . He was in exc shape and very healthy. He had surgery at 6:30 am and was in his room buy 1 pm He came home the next day and has done wonderful. Never needed and pain meds , very little incontinence , great path reports. He said it was easy and I hope it is for your hubby too.
Posts.Title: Surgery getting closer

Posts.Title: Surgery getting closer

Posts.Content: I haven't posted much but did learn a lot when my husband was diagnosed. He had Davinci last Feb and recoverd very well with no after effects. My question is he has developed what we believe to be a Hernia where the laparoscopic hole is where the take out the prostate. We see our surgeon in two we but have been told to see a general surgeon. Can these hernias be repaired laparoscopically or do they do an open surgery. Does anyone know the medical term for this particular hernia. Thank.
Posts.Title: Hernia after davinci

Posts.Content: My husband was a G 7. He chose surgery so that he knew it was gone and hopefully get a more accurate diagnosis. His report went down and we would never have had knowledge if he had chosen radiation. He also wanted the option of radiation for the future if the need ever came up. For him the surgery was easy went home after 24 hours with cath and drain ,they came out at 1 week.Now has undetectable PSA and all his path was contained. Good luck. I think you have made. Good choice
Posts.Title: Surgery Scheduled-

Posts.Title: Surgery Scheduled-

Posts.Content: My hubby was diagnosed early January with almost the same numbers as you and he chose surgery. His surgery was feb 20 th and it went very smooth. He had Davinci, 1 night in the hospital. 1 week with catheter and drain. Almost continent except for dribbles when straining. His pathology came back lower than original numbers. I do agree with the other post about your surgeon being very experienced. Our surgeon had done around 1200 so we were very comfortable . The thing we liked about the surgery for us was we felt we had a more accurate diagnoses and it was gone. Good luck. My friend.
Posts.Title: Another new member

Posts.Content: Try to not worry too much. My husband had a 7.2 3 yrs ag had all the scans, test etc. He had the Davinci surgery and has never looked back. I know it's hard not to worry. We go for PSA every 6 months and you breath a sigh of relief when the doctor say undetectable. Good luck.
Posts.Title: First Ever PSA Test Very Elevated Second Even Higher

Posts.Content: My hubby had his drain in for a week and after they took it out he drained for a out 10 days. Surgeon had us go back at a week and said as lo g as he was not feeling bad or running a fever it was okay. Some people just do that it seems. Good luck
Posts.Title: Post Op
